page.title: 08LOOKING AFTER MY PONY
page.content:
I have a pony called Star. He is black with a white sock on one foot and a white star on his forehead. That is how he got his name. I keep him in a field behind our house. We pay grazing rent to the farmer. In Winter I feed Star on hay in the morning and at night he is given pony nuts or a mixture of bran and sugar beet mixed with water. In Summer he does not need to be fed because there is enough grass. When it is hot the stream dries up so I fill an old bath with water for him to drink. In the Summer Mam and I wash him with horse shampoo. Sometimes I go for rides with my friends but usually Dad takes me to the football field.
{Rachel Lowdon Age 8
